sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Astronomical Tracts. Statutes etc.
Astronomica
msDesc.p:
Vellum, 335 225
13.2 x 8.5, ff. 99 + 1, double columns of 53 lines at first, then varying much. Several volumes, mostly of cent. xiv early.

Volume II a: In a larger hand, single columns.
Volume III: A smaller hand, double columns. - II b. The former hand.
Volume IV: A charter hand, foliated i-x on lower margins.
Volume V: A smaller hand which begins on the last page of vol. IV.
Collation: 1 flyleaf, 112 212 | 310 410 | 54 6 (two) | 712 8 (two) | 910 | 1012 | 116 12 (seven: 2 and 3 are slips: 4 is numbered vi: 7 is numbered x).

From Boxley Priory, Kent. On the flyleaf (f. 1v) is an erased inscription which revived reads:
liber S. Marie de Boxele emptus per dompnum Jo. heriettsham ab
executoribus m. Jo. Renham nuper rectoris de holyngbourne in
quem qui maliciose alienauerit anathema sit maranatha Amen.
There is a table of contents (f. 1v) (xv) headed: continentur.

msItem.head: Campanus of Novara, Theorica planetarum
msItem.incipit: Primus philosophie magister ipsius negocium in tria
msItem.ab: On 1v is sewn a volvel, on the back of which is part of a document, possibly a statute. The words occur ut adirent secum in Vascon. ad debelland. hostes, more of the same is on the back of a volvel on f. 6v
Ends
msItem.explicit: de mercurio supra docuimus deo gratias amen

msItem.incipit: Nota quod anno 1306 inperfectio 21 die aprilis fuit
msItem.ab: The years for which observations are made go up to 1315
On f. 24r is the beginning of a table of squares and cubes of numbers
f. 24v blank
On f. 25r - 25v two rough diagrams, the first headed
msItem.rubric: liber planetarum et quot circulos habent et qualiter mouentur et de quantitate eorum

msItem.incipit: Quia Anglicana mos est quod quilibet computans incipiet titulum compoti sui in crastino S. Michaelis
msItem.ab: List of principal feasts for the year 26v

msItem.head: Walter of Elveden, Kalendarium cum tribus cyclis decennoualibus
msItem.ab: (by Walter Elveden of Gonville Hall. See Venn, Biogr. Hist. 12)
This is in ordinary Kalendar form: entries in red and black
After the festival column follow others giving Hore diei. Hore noctis
This last is subdivided into Miliaria. Stadia. Passus. Pedes. Pollices. Grana
(As a fact the last three of these columns are filled with noughts throughout.) Each month has a statement of the average length of the day and the average length of the day's journey
The Kalendar is English but not very characteristic: Etheldreda, Mildred, Osith occur, but not Edith. Wulstan on Jan. 19 and June 7. Erkenwald on Ap. 30
On ff. 33r, 34r are tables of the Moon and of the Sunday letter
ff. 34v, 35r blank
On f. 35v rules for multiplication
msItem.incipit: Sunt autem vi Regule multiplicacionis etc.
msItem.ab: On f. 36r the large hand resumes: On multiplication
msItem.incipit: Numerus est multitudo ex unitate composita
msItem.ab: Table of Numbers
A second Kalendar
In the same hand as the former, marking the Locus Solis and also Ciclus 1, 2, 3
The entries are as in the former, but David and Edith are in their proper places
Tables of eclipses of Sun and Moon (1330 - 1386)
msItem.rubric: Lux est canon exponensis istud kalendarium

ab.decoNote: Diagrams of eclipses of Sun and Moon (in red and blue)

msItem.head: Alexander de Villa Dei, Massa compoti
msItem.incipit: Aureus in iano numerus clauesque nouantur
msItem.ab: Ending
msItem.explicit: Mobilis ibo ciphos ate liber habeto coenas

msItem.head: Alexander de Villa Dei, Algorismus
msItem.ab: (Alexandri de Villa Dei)
msItem.incipit: Hic algorismus ars presens dicitur in qua
msItem.explicit: Si par per medium sibi multiplicata propinqua
msItem.ab: Halliwell (Rara Mathematica) etc.

msItem.incipit: Aries est signum mobile calidum siccum etc.
msItem.ab: Ending (Pisces)
msItem.rubric: Dum Jupiter In Aquario Regnat multum gaudet

msItem.incipit: Si ascun homme saunz doute veut sauoir la verite des choses qe a luy pount auenir. Soulom sa destine
msItem.ab: The text goes through the signs, ending with Pisces
msItem.explicit: Ele viuera v. aunz ou xvij. ou L. aunz
msItem.rubric: Et sic finitur per bona temporalia ut non amittamus eterna per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen

msItem.head: pseudo-Hippocrates, Astrologia medicorum
msItem.rubric: Tractatus ypocratis pro infirmitatibus per astronomiam cognoscendis
msItem.incipit: Dicit ypocras qui fuit medicus et magister optimus quod nullus debet committere se in manus illius qui non est medicus perfectus
msItem.ab: Also goes through the signs, ending in Pisces
msItem.explicit: et si fortuna eam aspexerit uiuet si non morietur
msItem.ab: 65v is blank, and here ends vol. II which has an original foliation running from i to xxxv (26r - 65r) but wanting some leaves after xx (ff. 46r - 49r do not belong to it)
Headed
List of counties follows
Then
msItem.rubric: En cest liure sont escriptt touz les nouns des castelx dengleterre. et ensement Abbeez. et Prioreez en chescun countee
msItem.ab: Begins with Kent, ends with Stafford
After 69r and 71r are two small slips (f. 69ar and f. 71ar)
After Stafford (72r) are Archbishoprics and Bishoprics of England and Wales
Sum of Castles and Bishoprics. Then Cumberland (blank) and Westmorland
On f. 72v note in Latin of reigns from William I to Edward II (19 years 7 months). This is in different ink

msItem.rubric: Nomina Hundredorum Villarum et hamelettorum tocius Com. Suffolk
msItem.ab: Begins with Hertesmere (Hartismere) and ends with Lacford
In different ink
msItem.rubric: Nomina Hundredorum Villarum Hamelettorum tocius com. Hertford
msItem.ab: Begins with Oddeseles and ends with Libertas S. Albani
List of Hundreds in Berkshire
(French)
Latin note follows
msItem.incipit: Dominus Rex habebit tantum x milites etc.
msItem.ab: (French)
Rex Thesaurariis et Baronibus suis de Scaccario s. Ut indempnitate nostre. (Anno septimo)
A nostre seigneur le Roi et a son conseil monstre Thomas deuerwyke clerk pur profist le Roi
Le Roi veut que touz maners des Baillifs etc. ... soient responaunt a leschekier
Change of hand

Retorn of Brief, Names of freeholders
Placita

Other briefs, de priorissa de Haliwell etc.

head.title: Proceedings of the London Eyre, 1321 (Ordinances of the City of London)

msItem.ab: (French)
msItem.incipit: En primes que la poes dieux et la poes nostre seigneur le Roy

head.title: Proceedings of the London Eyre, 1321 (Writ, pleas)

msItem.ab: Breve regis de oppressionibus dampnis et grauaminibus (1318). Placita follow

head.title: List of values of English wool (per sack, by county)

msItem.ab: Value de Leyne dengleterre
List of counties

Londres: le sak pur vj marc
Kent: le sak pur vj marc
Surrey: le sak pur vj marc
Sussex: le sak pur vj marc
The highest is Hereford (xii marc.) the lowest (Northumberland, Cumberland, Westmorland, Durham) five marks

head.title: A petition against extortion from Lincoln, Derby, Leicester, etc.

msItem.ab: A petition against extortion from Lincoln, Derby, Leicester, etc. (French)
A Brief of Edward Ponderatori suo in villa de S. Boihulfo(?) (10 Edward II)

msItem.incipit: Elegantur primo per totam

head.title: Names of the Sheriffs of Scotland

msItem.ab: Change of hand
With sum of each Vicecomitatus
Some values of produce. Stirkes I anni prec. xxd etc.

msItem.incipit: Pur ceo que nostre seigneur le Roi voet estre asserte etc.

head.title: Terms of the surrender of Berwick

msItem.rubric: Les condicions sur le rendre de la ville de Berewyk (1333)

head.title: Prophecy of the conquest of Ireland

msItem.incipit: Scribitur in libris annalibus Hibernie secundum quod Mag. Walterus de Istelep Thesaurarius Hibern. eos inuestigans anno domini mo cccmo xvijo incipiente de prophetia super statu terre hibern. comper(i)t in hiis verbis. Cum enim quatuor hibernici prophetas habeant Molingum Bractannum Patricium et Colmekillum
msItem.ab: (prophecy of Conquest of Ireland)

head.title: Material relating to Ireland (fees, services, exchequer)

msItem.ab: Number of cantreds, villae etc. in Ireland
msItem.incipit: Seruicia domini Regis per totam Hiberniam (1317)
msItem.ab: Ending with
Ordinatio facta de Statuta Scaccarij Dublin
f. 95r (a slip, verso blank)

head.title: La copie dune lettre que vient de la onqe de la desconfiture que Mons. Roberd Dartois fist sur Fraunczois

msItem.rubric: La copie dune lettre que vient de la onqe de la desconfiture que Mons. Roberd Dartois fist sur Fraunczois
msItem.ab: Another hand
f. 96v a slip, recto blank
msItem.incipit: En droit des noueles de cestes parties voilletz sauoir que nostre seigneur le Roy ... est deuaunt la ville de Tournoye

head.title: La fforme del Trewe prise entre Sire Edward Roy dengleterre et Sire Philippe Roy de France (1343)

msItem.rubric: La fforme del Trewe prise entre Sire Edward Roy dengleterre et Sire Philippe Roy de France

msItem.ab: Verses in two columns. The first column miscellaneous
msItem.incipit: Qui scit adulari gratis debet famulari etc.
msItem.ab: Ending with some lines on the age of the Virgin (63 years)
The second column a dialogue between Monacha and Clericus

lg.l: Me tibi teque mihi genus etas et decor equant
Cur non ergo sumus sic in amore pares

msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.explicit: Est grauius sponsam te uiolare dei
msItem.ab: See Hauréau in Notices et Extraits XXIX 2. 249. Also Hagen, Carmina medii aevi, p. 206

msItem.rubric: De pondere et mensuris rerum diuersarum
msItem.incipit: Solidus argenti constat ex xii denariis etc.

head.title: Treatise on the method of measuring land

msItem.incipit: Primo sciendum est quod quelibet acra terre

head.title: Cest le arrai et lassemble des gentz Descoce que vindrent a la bataille de Berewik. Cest assauoir

msItem.incipit: Cest le arrai et lassemble des gentz Descoce que vindrent a la bataille de Berewik. Cest assauoir ... auant garde le coumt de Morrene
msItem.ab: 100v was pasted over with paper (repaired since James' time)
